description: Dive into "Picture-Perfect Moments in Amalfi" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Picture-Perfect Moments in Amalfi

places.generalDescription: Villa Rufolo is a 13th-century villa with Moorish influences, renowned for its stunning cascading gardens and terraces that offer breathtaking views of the sea. Over the years, it has become a significant tourist attraction, especially after hosting the first editions of Wagner's Concerts in its gardens. The Villa's international reputation grew further when it was acquired by the Provincial Tourist Board of Salerno and opened to the public.

sources.snippet: The accompanying Terrazzo dell‚Äôlnfinito (Terrace of Infinity) garden is undoubtedly the most beautiful spot in Ravello. The garden is filled with sculptures with sea view and is one of the most Instagrammable places in Amalfi Coast. Did you know a scene in Wonder Woman, the movie was filmed at Villa Cimbrone?

places.name: Villa Rufolo

reviews.text:
Villa Rufolo
This place is absolutely breathtaking-truly beyond imagination. The views feel like something out of a movie. If you're visiting the Amalfi Coast, this is a must-see destination. However, keep in mind that driving there on your own can be challenging. The roads are narrow with very tight corners, so if you tend to get anxious while driving under pressure, I highly recommend joining a tour or hiring a driver to save yourself the stress of navigating and finding parking.

Villa Rufolo is a must - see hot spots destination for anyone visiting the Amalfi Coast.

A real hidden gem on the Amalfi Coast and one of my favorite place to see it.

This is nature's artwork on display .
A very impressive, stunning place with a unique color of the spirits, worth all the raves about it.

Worth spending a day here soaking in the ambience, surrounded by incredible scenery, pure natural peaceful, beautiful masterpieces of gardens and magnificent spectacular breathtaking views from every corner.

It's a truly enchanting and experience visiting this beautiful place

There is beauty around every bend.

Serenity in every view!!!

Simply breathtaking!!!

Main garden closed should be told when buying ticket, misleading. Gardeners walking around with cigarettes in the month just yapping. Supposed to be a peaceful place but just felt weird there. End of the season is coming so I understand but should have mentioned the main garden they use in all the pictures is closed and covered by a concert layout‚Ä¶ not worth ‚Ç¨7 entree for that‚Ä¶ but beautiful views that are normal in Ravello.

places.generalDescription: The Amalfi Coast is a UNESCO-listed landscape featuring small towns perched between mountains and the sea. A popular activity is the Classic Amalfi Coast walking tour, an 11-day journey along the Footpath of the Gods, offering unrivaled Italian coastal hiking. The self-guided walk allows exploration at a personalized pace through idyllic villages like Praiano, Positano, Sorrento, Amalfi, and Maestra dei Villaggi.

sources.snippet: The Amalfi Coast in Italy is a paradise for travelers and photographers alike, known for its stunning landscapes and vibrant charm. One of the standout locations is Positano, famous for its colorful cliffside houses and beautiful beaches. The Pensione Maria offers an authentic local experience with great views, perfect for capturing memorable moments.
sources.shortName: Incredible Photo Spots Along the Amalfi Coast

sources.snippet: The Amalfi Coast is arguably one of the most beautiful places in Italy and Positano is its crown jewel. This entire area is an Instagrammers and photographers heaven!. This post covers the best Instagram Photo Spots in Positano and the Amalfi Coast.
sources.shortName: The Best Instagram Photo Spots in Positano and the Amalfi Coast

places.name: Amalfi Coast

reviews.text:
Breathtaking and unforgettable!

The Amalfi Coast is truly one of the most stunning places you'll ever see-the views are absolutely postcard-perfect at every turn. Towering cliffs, sparkling turquoise waters, and picturesque villages make this destination something straight out of a dream.

I highly recommend visiting by coach if possible. The roads are incredibly narrow, winding, and steep, and while experienced drivers might manage, it's not for the faint-hearted! If you do decide to drive, go for a small car-a big vehicle would be a real challenge on those roads.

Beaches are beautiful but often require a walk down the cliffs, and some do charge for entry. It's worth it for the experience, though! The restaurants along the coast are wonderful-laid-back, welcoming, and happy to let you enjoy your meal without rushing you, which is refreshing in such a popular tourist spot.

Parking is expensive-around ‚Ç¨10 per hour-so if you're driving, plan to make the most of your time there.

Honestly, words don't do it justice-I'll let the pictures speak for themselves. A place you'll never forget!

Most beautiful place
One day trip it's enough but easily you can stay more
There is a lot of hotels
And beautiful places to see
And beaches
The road is beautiful
We took car that can open the roof
So the view was amazing.

The road is with a lot of curves so need to drive slowly
I recommend to take a small car it will be easier to maneuver.
there is difficult to find parking except the parking lots

Just drive along the road the pictures
Stop where you can
And enjoy

In the summer there is a lots of cars so prepare yourself üôèüòÄ

So far my favorite area / day excursion this trip. The small towns tucked into the hill sides all the way down to the pristine beaches. Exquisite. Don't let the "life style of the rich and famous" reputation run you off because the small towns are amazing and the locals even better.

places.generalDescription: Amalfi Harbor Marina Coppola is located just a short walk from the beach in Amalfi Town. The marina offers stunning views of the sea and lush vegetation, making it a popular spot on the Amalfi Coast. Visitors can admire beautiful powered boats and sailboats, as well as fishing boats bringing in fresh catches for local restaurants. Guided by skilled mariner Giulio, the marina stands out for its tight entrance maneuvering and bustling yet energetic ambiance.

sources.snippet: If you walk about five minutes into Amalfi Town straight from the beach and Marina Coppola (down Via Duca Mansone I, to be exact), you will eventually run into Duomo Di Amalfi (Amalfi Cathedral). Feel free to stop here and take pictures outside from the piazza, inside the arches, and even from inside the arches looking outside.
sources.shortName: 30 Amalfi Coast Instagram Spots For Iconic Photos (Map & Photos)

sources.snippet: It is one of the most beautiful marinas with blue green water. The marina overlooking the hills is a perfect location for photos.

places.name: Amalfi Harbor Marina Coppola

reviews.text: There is no place like Amalfi.   It's my new favorite go-to place.  There are a number of restaurants along the Harbor, all with fantastic views. And great food, and you can walk along the pier after dinner.

Exceptional Service at the Port of Amalfi ‚Äì A True Maritime Masterclass

If you're sailing along the Amalfi Coast and looking for a safe, reliable, and highly professional port experience, look no further than Amalfi Port ‚Äì and more specifically, the outstanding services of Giulio Coppola.

From the moment we approached, Giulio was already in action. He came out directly to meet our boat, expertly guiding us into position with an impressive level of precision that you rarely find nowadays. The manoeuvre was flawless - like watching a seasoned maestro at work. He didn't just assist; he took control with calm, confident authority and made a potentially tricky mooring look effortless.

This kind of hands-on, on-the-water service is increasingly rare. Giulio's approach isn't just helpful - it's absolutely first-class. He clearly knows every current, wind shift and centimetre of that port like the back of his hand. It's no exaggeration to say this is someone who's spent a lifetime mastering the sea.

Beyond his technical skill, Giulio is also courteous, responsive, and fully focused on making sure your experience in Amalfi begins with the kind of welcome you'd expect from a top-tier marina. It's the kind of service that makes a difference - especially when arriving in a tight, often busy port.

To sum it up:
‚úÖ Incredible docking precision
‚úÖ Hands-on assistance right from your arrival
‚úÖ True professionalism and local expertise
‚úÖ One of the best mooring experiences we've ever had

Highly recommended for anyone arriving by sea in Amalfi. Thank you, Giulio ‚Äì you set the standard.
This place is amazing. Definetely worth vising. Some of the most amazing views. Parking is pretty expensive, but it's worth it. You can also rent a boat for 3 hours for a hefty price

places.address: Piazzale dei Protontini, 6, 84011 Amalfi SA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Valle delle Ferriere is a deep valley on the Amalfi coast, offering a unique break from the beaches. The trail starts in Pontone and ends in Amalfi, passing by ruins of medieval foundries and water mills that once powered the town's paper-making industry. This nature reserve provides a quiet escape from the bustling world, with two different routes available for hikers to explore.

sources.snippet: If you want to surprise your followers, walk along one of the most evocative naturalistic trails of the Amalfi Coast: the Valle delle Ferriere. There are plenty of wonderful glimpses to photograph and once inside the valley, the scenery looks like a fairy-tale. After adding new instagram stories, I am sure your followers will wonder where you are.
sources.shortName: The iconic photo spot of the Amalfi Coast

places.name: Valle delle Ferriere

reviews.text:
We did the tour mid March, starting from Pontone. There is parking along the street which is cheap in the off-season from December till March. In the summer it's probably hard to get a spot here.

The hard parts of this route is the track from Amalfi to Pontone (1000 steps) and from Amalfi to the nature reserve (probably the nicer walk alongside the stream). We skipped those and went from Pontone straight to the nature reserve (45 minutes to the sign at the ruins, then 30 minutes to the reserve).

Unfortunately the reserve was closed. Maybe it's only open at the weekend in the off-season. If you follow the stream to the fence you can see the small waterfall anyway.

We really enjoyed the tour. It was quiet and peaceful and the nature was beautiful.

A must visit!!!
45 minutes hike away from Amalfi, the place is a time forgotten, intact, simply beautiful, and breathtaking.
Tingly recommended.

We started the Valle delle Ferriere hike right after arriving in Amalfi and it was such a great way to kick things off. If you're looking to get away from the busy town and enjoy some peace, nature, and amazing views, we totally recommend it. At one point we reached the Natura 2000 reserve, where there's a small ‚Ç¨5 entrance fee per person. After seeing some beautiful views, we continued toward Pontone and eventually made our way back to Amalfi. The hike was a bit tiring in places, but honestly, the scenery made it 100% worth it. A beautiful trail and a great adventure overall!

sources.snippet: If you walk about five minutes into Amalfi Town straight from the beach and Marina Coppola (down Via Duca Mansone I, to be exact), you will eventually run into Duomo Di Amalfi (Amalfi Cathedral). Feel free to stop here and take pictures outside from the piazza, inside the arches, and even from inside the arches looking outside.
sources.shortName: 30 Amalfi Coast Instagram Spots For Iconic Photos (Map & Photos)

places.name: Spiaggia di Atrani

reviews.text: After a visiting the coast the boat ride was magnificent. A true pleasure to see the different buildings and places.

The Spiaggia di Atrani, located in the small coastal village of Atrani on the Amalfi Coast, is a charming hidden gem. This compact, cozy beach features a mix of sand and pebbles, nestled beneath pastel-colored houses that seem to cling to the cliffs.

Key Features:
‚Ä¢	Size: Small and intimate, ideal for those seeking tranquility compared to the busier beaches of the Amalfi Coast.
‚Ä¢	Accessibility: Just a short walk from the village's main square, making it easily accessible on foot.
‚Ä¢	Atmosphere: With its picturesque surroundings and authentic charm, it offers a more laid-back and local experience than larger tourist hotspots.

This beach is perfect for enjoying the Mediterranean's crystal-clear waters while immersing yourself in the unique ambiance of one of Italy's most beautiful villages.

Lovely black sand and pebbles beach with clear water in an amazing setting. Not crowded at all and no sunbeds / umbrellas at the end of May. Everything about this beach has an authentic Italian vibe and we loved every second we stayed here.

There are several caffes around where you can buy drinks and food and take them to the beach (PLEASE CLEAN UP AFTER YOURSELF!)

There are public parking spaces right near the beach but we couldn't find any avaliabke spots, so we parked in a private parking on the main road.

places.address: Via Nicolangelo Protopisani, 5, 84010 Atrani SA, Italy

places.generalDescription: The Cathedral of St. Andrew Apostle, also known as the Cathedral of Amalfi, is a historic church located in the town of Amalfi in Campania, Italy. Originally built in the 10th century and later expanded into a grand Roman church with multiple porches and halls, it has undergone several renovations over the centuries. The entrance features a bronze gate from Constantinople and golden mosaics depicting Moorish life.

sources.snippet: King of the Amalfi Instagram spots is the cathedral of Sant‚ÄôAndrea, which is conveniently placed right in the middle of town. It was constructed in a Byzantine style, making it quite unusual, and deliciously photographic. Stand in the piazza just in front of the Cathedral for the best view, though you will need to time it well ‚Äì there‚Äôs a constant stream of visitors passing through.
sources.shortName: Instagrammable Spots on the Amalfi Coast: How to Get Amazing Photos!

sources.snippet: The Cathedral of Amalfi, which stands in the homonymous square, will surprise you with its facade and huge staircase. Seeing this spot is a must if you want to take a picture of its details, such as the wonderful bell tower or to take some selfies with the Cathedral in the background.
sources.shortName: The iconic photo spot of the Amalfi Coast

places.name: Cathedral of St Andrew Apostle

reviews.text:
Cost around 5 euro per person to enter the cathedral. You really can't miss it - only 2 minutes away from the shore front where the bus or ferry drops you off.

Full of incredible artefacts and beautifully preserved. The cathedral itself is jaw dropping inside. The rich history of the cathedral and its artefacts is regularly denoted by signs.

There are signs requesting that you dress moderately, don't use a flash camera and respect the sanctity of the cathedral. That being said, there were plenty of people taking pictures inside‚Ä¶. As with most of the Churches and Cathedrals we visited in Italy you can light a candle beside a voluntary donation box.

I would not recommend trying to eat your lunch on the Cathedral steps as the Carabinieri will get out of their Alfa Romeo and shout at you. We saw this happen leaving the Cathedral and a second time having had our lunch up the street.

Beautiful Cathedral in a stunning location - just don't try to eat on the Cathedral steps. Italian police don't like having to leave their Alfa.

Beautiful cathedral, well worth the ‚Ç¨4 entry (‚Ç¨3 concessions). Not horrendously busy, lots to see. We particularly enjoyed the mosaics.
I've dropped one star because I suspect that the English captions (translations from Italian) have been done by AI or a similar system - they're not at all readable. For example, one caption refers to "vegetables" around a figure on a plinth, when it intends to say "vegetation". We were also concerned about the lack of protection for most of the mosaics and sculptures. You'd like to think that people can be trusted not to touch artefacts, but as has been seen at sites like Pompeii, that's not always the case.

The Cathedral of St. Andrew the Apostle is strikingly beautiful and sits right at the center of Amalfi's main piazza. You'll enter by climbing a dramatic grand staircase, which makes the whole experience feel even more impressive. Inside, the cathedral features stunning marble throughout and intricately detailed painted mural ceilings.

The crypt, which holds the relics of St. Andrew, is a peaceful space still used for prayer, adding to the spiritual depth of the visit. Just off the main cathedral is the Cloister of Paradise, a quiet and beautiful courtyard surrounded by elegant columns and arches.

There's also a small museum on-site with religious artifacts, including a display case said to hold a thorn from the crown of Jesus during the crucifixion. Whether you're visiting for the history, architecture, or spiritual connection, the cathedral leaves a lasting impression.

places.generalDescription: The Duomo of Saint Mary of the Assumption, also known as the Ravello Cathedral, is a historic church with a rich heritage. Built in 1086 by order of the first Ravello bishop, Orso Papirio, it boasts unique decorative features including mosaics and sculptures.

sources.snippet: The stairs leading up to the Duomo provide the perfect photo spot, with a simple white background and beautiful architecture you can‚Äôt miss out on this photo opportunity.
sources.shortName: Photo Spots In Ravello For Instagram Photos

places.name: Duomo di ravello

reviews.text:
The Duomo of Saint Mary of the Assumption in Ravello is an absolutely stunning backdrop for a wedding photoshoot. I had the privilege of capturing magical moments in front of its historic facade, surrounded by the charm and elegance of Ravello's timeless beauty. This location, with its rich history and breathtaking views, adds a touch of romance and grandeur to any celebration.

If you're planning your dream wedding in Ravello, this is a must-visit spot-and don't forget to have a photographer who can bring these moments to life. Highly recommend this iconic destination!

The Duomo of Saint Mary is a decent cathedral, but it definitely fell short of my expectations. The cathedral area was pretty large and had some unique character. However, the walls were mostly white with little artwork. There was also a museum with old empty sarcophaguses, church artifacts, and sculptures dating back to the 13th century. It was a good experience, but it didn't blow me away. If you're in the area, I would recommend going to the nearby Amalfi Cathedral instead. It's the same price (4 euros) and it blows this cathedral away in size and ornateness.
The duomo of Ravello is quite beautiful, yet the least interesting sight in the village. The most important part are the mosaic covered pulpits inside.

places.generalDescription: In the heart of Amalfi, there stands a marvel known as Saint Andrew's Fountain. This baroque-style fountain, built in 1760, is a significant attraction on the main square. Opposite the Cathedral, it features an unusual mermaid statue that often sparks amusement among visitors. The fountain serves as a gathering spot for locals and tourists alike, especially in the evenings when the street is closed to traffic. Surrounding it are restaurants and shops offering local products.

sources.snippet: This rather painful-looking statue is something of a novelty, but it‚Äôs bound to get a laugh from your followers, especially if accompanied by a pithy comment!. You can find this rather unfortunate mermaid in the fountain just opposite the Cathedral. entrance (which seems a bit of a weird place for it, right?)
sources.shortName: Instagrammable Spots on the Amalfi Coast: How to Get Amazing Photos!

places.name: Saint Andrew's Fountain Amalfi

reviews.text: a historic fountain located in the town's central square, near the Amalfi Cathedral. it is surrounded by many small shops for lemon sorbet and restaurants. The fountain is an artistic picturesque and one of the must visit places. Small streets lined with local products shops are also there.
It's such a beautiful square in front of an amazing church. It's such a delightful scene to watch all the people
Intricately carved figures.  Beautiful fountain!

places.generalDescription: Nestled within a hotel yet welcoming to everyone, Sea Waves Bar is a stunning destination that promises an unforgettable experience. With its breathtaking views of the coastline, this bar offers not just delicious drinks but also a serene atmosphere enhanced by soothing music. Guests rave about the exceptional cocktails and delightful food, all served by friendly staff who make you feel right at home. Whether you're lounging with friends or enjoying a romantic evening, Sea Waves Bar is definitely worth a visit when in Amalfi!

sources.snippet: You‚Äôll probably find heaps of spots along the coast where you can capture the seascape and the lights. To me, Conca dei Marini has turned out to be an insider. It is a little town with a perfect view of the houses in the rocks, the coast and Amalfi.
While the sun disappears in the sea and the sky turns red, you could make a time-lapse or take a picture for your instagram profile. You will get a lot of likes!
sources.shortName: The iconic photo spot of the Amalfi Coast

places.name: Sea Waves Bar

reviews.text: Beautiful bar in a hotel but open to all! Drinks were wonderful but the view is incredible. Gorgeous view of the coast line. Music playing and it makes the vibe feel very relaxed and chill. Would definitely come back here! Drinks and food were both DELICIOUS. Staff is warm and welcoming.

As a cocktail enthusiast I was so excited to discover via Google that there was this divine cocktail bar and terrace just a stroll down from our accommodations in Amalfi. Thank you to Claudio and the rest of the team for your lovely hospitality, divine cocktails (such intriguing local-inspired flavour profiles with elevated and modern mixology and presentation) which live up to the beautiful location and ambiance.
The drinks were AMAZING! An inviting savory twist with incredible views and vibes. Although it had stormed just before our arrival they staff had the roof top bar looking Fabulous!

places.address: Via Lungomare dei Cavalieri, 16, 84011 Amalfi SA, Italy
